msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division.

body.p: The President of the United States,
To the Honorable Judge of the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division,

Greeting: Whereas, lately in the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, before you or some of you in a cause entitled In The Matter of the Petition of K. Gregory, et al. for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, No. 2646, and Order was duly made on the 27th day of January, A.D. 1914, and filed on the 2nd day of February, A.D. 1914, granting the Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and Ordering the discharge of all of the Petitioners etc.; which said Order is of record in the said Matter in the office of the clerk of the said District Court (to which record reference is hereby made and the same is hereby expressly made a part hereof),

as by the inspection of the Transcript of the Record of the said District Court which was brought into the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit by virtue of an appeal prosecuted by Henry M. White, Commissoner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, for the United States Government, as Appellant, against K. Gregory, M. Aloshin, I. Riahoff, p> Neahlin, I. Emelin, L. Orloff, G. Yakimoff and P. Yakimoff, as Appellees, agreeable to the Act of Congress in such cases made and provided fully and at large appears:

And Whereas on the 4th day of May in the year of our Lord One Thousand Nine Hundred and Fourteen the said cause came on to be heard before the said Curcuit Court of Appeals on the said Transcript of the Record and was duly argued and submitted:

On the Consideration Whereof, It is now here ordered, adjudged, and decreed by this court, that the order and judgment of the said District Court in this cause be, and hereby are reversed, with instructions to dismiss the writ of habeas corpus. May 18, 1914

You Therefor Are Hereby Commanded That such execution, dismissal, and further proceedings be had in the said cause in accordance with the Opinion and Decree of this Court and as according to right and justice and the laws of the United States ought to be had, the said order of the said District Court notwithstanding.

Witness, the Honorable Edward Douglas Wright, Chief Justice of the United States, the 18th day of June, in the year of our Lord One Thousand Nine Hundred and Fourteen, and of the Independence of the United States of America the One Hundred and Thirty-Eighth.
Chief of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth District
